p: The antitumor activity of S. crispa β-glucan has been previously examined alone or in combination with some chemotherapeutics. As demonstrated by [ 41], polysaccharide fractions from S. crispa exhibited anticancer activity to the solid form of Sarcoma 180 in mice and showed a hematopoietic response to cyclophosphamide-induced leukopenia in mice. Moreover, β-glucan from S. crispa suppressed the number and growth of lung metastatic colonies in B16-BL6-bearing mice [ 42].
